entry.title: Matplotlib Figure Size – How to Change Plot Size in Python with plt.figsize()
entry.summary: When creating plots using Matplotlib, you get a default figure size of 6.4 for the width and 4.8 for the height (in inches). In this article, you'll learn how to change the plot size using the following: * The figsize() attribute. * The set_figwidth() method.

entry.title: Web Accessibility – Common ARIA Mistakes to Avoid
entry.summary: Accessible Rich Internet Applications – or ARIA – is a set of attributes and roles defined by the Web Accessibility Initiative [https://www.w3.org/WAI/]. entry.title: Deploying CSS Logical Properties On Web Apps
entry.summary: You may have already heard of CSS logical properties or RTL adaptations but are still deciding whether to deploy them widely.
